thread.title: Police responding to reports of gunfire at Houston hospital
thread.title_full: Police responding to reports of gunfire at Houston hospital

title: Police responding to reports of gunfire at Houston hospital
text:
Police searching for suspect following reports of gunfire at Houston hospital By Associated Press 
Police in Houston say they’re searching for a suspect after responding to reports of shots fired inside a hospital at Houston's Texas Medical Center. 
Houston police chief Art Acevedo said no one was injured at the hospital and no suspect has been found. 
“We have not found anyone injured, we have not found anyone shot, we have not found a suspect,” he told reporters. 
Mr Acevedo said a full search had been made of all six of the building’s floors, and the basement, but had not turned up any evidence of a shooting. 
He said authorities began receiving reports of a shooting at Ben Taub Hospital, one of the hospitals that's part of the Medical Center, shortly after 2pm (7am AEDT). 
“There were multiple reports from this location of shots being fired and a white male, unknown age, bald, being described as a suspect,” he said. 
Around 200 police officers responded to the reports of a shooting, ABC13 reports . 
Television images from helicopters show dozens of employees leaving the hospital, some of them attending to patients who appear to have been evacuated on gurneys. 
Ben Taub General Hospital was been target by a shooting in October 2014 when a female employee was shot dead by a male colleague. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
